net.xqhs.util.logging

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xqhs.util.logging.Unit
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UnitComponent

    public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    The Unit class should be extended by any class using a log obtained from Logging.

    It is characterized by the unitName, which also gives the name of (and helps refer) the log.

    Although not abstract, the Unit should not be used as a member of a class, as no logging functions are available. This purpose is fulfilled by UnitComponent.

    On construction, the name can be the DEFAULT_UNIT_NAME, in which case the class name is used; null, in which case a log is not created; or another name that should be unique across the JVM.

    It is guaranteed that after construction the Unit has a non-null, valid Config.

    The unit also serves as access to logging functions offered by the contained Log.

    The sole purpose of the Unit layer of an instance is to handle logging.

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        public Unit()
        Constructs a new Unit, using a default UnitConfigData instance. It will not have a name.

      • Unit

        public Unit(UnitConfigData configuration)
        Constructs a Unit according to the given configuration.

        If the configured name is null, but the instance overrides the getDefaultUnitName() method, then the value returned by that method will be used.

        If the name is null and there is no override of getDefaultUnitName(), no log will be created and the elements in the configuration will be of no effect.

        If the name is DEFAULT_UNIT_NAME, the name of the class will be used.

        In all the special cases above, the name in the configuration will be modified to the new value.

        See UnitConfigData for other settings that can be used.

        Parameters:
        configuration - : the configuration.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultUnitName

        protected java.lang.String getDefaultUnitName()
        This member offers a simpler way to give the default unit name, by reinitializing it. It also offers a simple switch to switch the log level to the default level.

        WARNING: making this dynamic (return different values at different times) is useless; the method will be called only when the unit is constructed and the name returned will remain set.

      • makeLogName

        private java.lang.String makeLogName()
        Produces the actual name of the log, based on the unit name.

        This only differs from the unit name if config.addClassName is specified.

        Returns:
        the name of the log.

      • getUnitName

        protected java.lang.String getUnitName()
        This method is only accessible inside the instance, except if for good reasons an extending class makes it public.
        Returns:
        the Unit name, as given to or set in the constructor.

      • doExit

        protected void doExit()
        Instructs the Unit to exit. This method is only accessible inside the instance, except if for good reasons an extending class makes it public.

        As the Unit layer only manages logging, the only thing that happens is that the log exists (if any).
